title: Consistent ping spikes?
body: I've never before had ping spikes...But since the  patch  or so atleast once a game i will have a ping spike up to 75 (Feels like 125 i swear) And 150. And my ping stays that high for around 2-3 minutes. Now i have no idea if its the game cause it started around once the patch hit or if its my isp (Charter) And i have no idea how to check without going ingame then once the ping spike hits tab out and try a speed test or something. So how would i check whos end this is on? I should also add sometimes my ping spikes up to 500 and i just start attempting to recconect

replies.body: I don't know if mines fixed or not but my first two games today had stable ping with only minimal packet loss. The two after that were completely fine. Going into a ranked hoping for the same.

Same. I'm a charter customer and these lag spikes have been happening for a few days. It happens every game and around the start of lanning phase. Without fail around the 2 minute mark for a couple minutes. It goes away but always comes back. I pretty much know I won't win games these last few days. Playing from behind from the start every game is getting old as well as random spikes in game deciding fights.
Same issue as all of the above. game constantly ping spikes up to 150 at nights also on charter it definitely looks like an issue
I can confirm I have charter and I am experiencing both input lag and high ping.

I've actually performed a traceroute during one of these ping spikes which are exactly what I have been experiencing. The problem doesn't seem to be with any of my equipment or anything to do with my set up (I sent this information in a ticket, though rather sloppy so it's likely to be overlooked...)

C:\Users>tracert 192.64.170.1

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  router.asus.com [192.168.1.1]
  2     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  3    11 ms    15 ms    15 ms  dtr02ovldmo-tge-0-6-0-0.ovld.mo.charter.com [96.34.52.229]
  4    12 ms    11 ms    18 ms  crr02ovldmo-tge-0-7-0-9.ovld.mo.charter.com [96.34.50.0]
  5    15 ms    36 ms    29 ms  crr01olvemo-bue-200.olve.mo.charter.com [96.34.76.137]
  6    24 ms    11 ms    23 ms  bbr01olvemo-bue-70.olve.mo.charter.com [96.34.2.164]
  7    20 ms    30 ms    23 ms  bbr02chcgil-bue-2.chcg.il.charter.com [96.34.0.12]
  8    22 ms    17 ms    18 ms  prr01chcgil-bue-4.chcg.il.charter.com [96.34.3.11]
  9     *      215 ms     *     eqix-ch2.chi01.riotdirect.net [206.223.119.235]    <------------ right here
 10   213 ms   217 ms   211 ms  104.160.131.46
 11   136 ms   168 ms   169 ms  104.160.131.103
 12   187 ms     *      199 ms  192.64.170.1

Trace complete.


I had a ping test running with google's dns during the even and at no point did I receive any type of ping spike that would match the ping spike I had during the game. This pretty much verifies that the only thing I'm connecting too where I experience lag is with Riot's NA server. 

I would also like to stress that all of us who are having this issue probably have never experienced lag on our connections prior to this patch and have made no changes to our current set ups that would cause it.

Reviewing your traceroute, it looks like your ISP is having problems upon reaching our server.  For your specific issue, reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can gather more data and look for options for you as well as others having potential ISP issues.

Oh yeah, and this is what it looks like when it is not lagging, just for your reference

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.10240]
(c) 2015 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

C:\Users>tracert 192.64.170.1

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  router.asus.com [192.168.1.1]
  2     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  3    12 ms    10 ms    14 ms  dtr02ovldmo-tge-0-6-0-0.ovld.mo.charter.com [96.34.52.229]
  4    20 ms    11 ms    33 ms  crr02ovldmo-tge-0-7-0-10.ovld.mo.charter.com [96.34.50.2]
  5    24 ms    13 ms    34 ms  crr01olvemo-bue-200.olve.mo.charter.com [96.34.76.137]
  6    20 ms    30 ms    11 ms  bbr01olvemo-bue-70.olve.mo.charter.com [96.34.2.164]
  7    45 ms    30 ms    14 ms  bbr02chcgil-bue-2.chcg.il.charter.com [96.34.0.12]
  8    27 ms    15 ms    17 ms  prr01chcgil-bue-4.chcg.il.charter.com [96.34.3.11]
  9    27 ms    14 ms    17 ms  eqix-ch2.chi01.riotdirect.net [206.223.119.235]   <--------- pretty big difference right here
 10    14 ms    15 ms    14 ms  104.160.131.44
 11    22 ms    30 ms    27 ms  104.160.131.103
 12    17 ms    27 ms    18 ms  192.64.170.1

Trace complete.

Sudden lag spikes or input delay could be due to your ISP's routing, but there are other steps we can take to rule out other possibilities that generally come with network problems.  For your specific issue, I suggest running a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to get an overview of these lag spikes.  The results will also provide a list of steps specific to your issue towards a resolution.  This should help you out!

I'm suffering from packet loss...None of this happened before the last patch and most of the solutions here i've tried already

It's a bummer to hear that, but we'd like to continue helping if we can.  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team can help figure out what's going on.  You may also want to use our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to gather some logs for context, and attach it to your ticket.  Hang tight until we are able to respond to your ticket!
I'm having the same experience i think it's because the last update from Windows 10, the 1607 build, you need to deactivate the GameDVR i think, didn't work for me but give it a try!

Hey! Same with me... I have Charter as my internet provider as well and the ping has been garbage for the last 3-4 days now...
I believe it's most likely Riot's server that isn't compatible with Charter's internet service... That happened many times in the past, so I'm pretty sure it's the same thing that happened with Riot's server. I wanted to login and make a post about this but it seems I'm not the only one. Riot really gotta look at this and fix it. It just cost me a rank game of league that I was suppose to win.
